Yes. Ever look at the pacific ocean from space? Islands are impossible to see.

Yes. Ever look at the pacific ocean from space? Islands are impossible to see.

I seem to be able to see islands of much smaller size on Kerbin just fine.

Me too

ten

Okay, I'm not certain what I've done wrong. I downloaded Planetfactory CE correctly, as far as I know. II'm pretty sure I downloaded Universe correctly too, but that made the game crash. Putting the Universe planetfactory file into Plugins made it kind of work, but only in 64 bit, but not for very long. While it was working, everything looks like it's in the right place, but the camera and the orbits were all shaky. I tried loading a ship, but that crashed it. What am I doing wrong? Does it matter that I'm in version .23.5.464?

Okay, I'm not certain what I've done wrong. I downloaded Planetfactory CE correctly, as far as I know. II'm pretty sure I downloaded Universe correctly too, but that made the game crash. Putting the Universe planetfactory file into Plugins made it kind of work, but only in 64 bit, but not for very long. While it was working, everything looks like it's in the right place, but the camera and the orbits were all shaky. I tried loading a ship, but that crashed it. What am I doing wrong? Does it matter that I'm in version .23.5.464?

Install it normally but update your KSP...

Shaky orbits are a PF bug in 64-bit. No fix yet.
Thanks for answering all of the bug reports in my absence. Good to know people still care.

Thanks for answering all of the bug reports in my absence. Good to know people still care.
